item.title: Nexperia parent shares jump 6% as Beijing signals thaw in tensions with Netherlands
item.description: The dispute over ownership and control of the Dutch-based Nexperia has led global automakers to warn impacts from a shortage of chip supplies.

item.title: Consumer sentiment nears lowest level ever as worries build over shutdown
item.description: A University of Michigan sentiment survey showed a decline of 6.2% on the month and about 30% from a year ago.

item.title: Chicago Fed's Goolsbee says he's cautious about further rate cuts during shutdown
item.description: The central bank official said told CNBC that he has concerns because of the lack of inflation reports.

item.title: 'We're past peak-restrictiveness,' BOE governor says, as bets rise on Christmas rate cut
item.description: The central bank was seen as more likely to hold rates than not, according to economists.

item.title: Job cuts in October hit highest level for the month in 22 years, Challenger says
item.description: Job cuts for October totaled 153,074, a 183% surge from September.
